content.raw:
In 1564e03 on branch issue_623_nsleep_10000, I tested reducing the sleep time from 30 ms, to 10 micro-seconds. I started getting SIGABRT's when deleting models. For example, insert a box, then right click and delete the box could cause a crash. Here's a backtrace from one of these crashes, that seems to occur at [Node::ProcessIncoming in Node.cc:150](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/dbfff75bb967041830bc084139a3fbdaa79e2dc4/gazebo/transport/Node.cc#cl-150):

ConnectionManager sleeps for 30 ms between message updates

content.raw:
I'm still having some issues, even with pull request #434.

Procedure:

1. `gzserver` in one terminal
2. `gzstats` in another terminal
2. `gzclient` in another terminal (optional)
3. make sure you have the bookshelf model in your .gazebo/models folder
4. run the following in a third terminal; it just spawns and deletes models repeatedly with gzfactory
~~~
for i in `seq 1 10`; do \
  gzfactory spawn -f ~/.gazebo/models/bookshelf/model-1_3.sdf -m bookshelf_$i && \
  sleep 0.5 && \
  gzfactory delete -m bookshelf_$i && \
  sleep 0.5; done
~~~
After a couple iterations, it will hang, which can be verified by watching gzstats. I did `gdb gzserver` one time to see where it was hanging and got a backtrace:
~~~

content.html:
I'm still having some issues, even with pull request #434.

Procedure:

  1. gzserver in one terminal
  2. gzstats in another terminal
  3. gzclient in another terminal (optional)
  4. make sure you have the bookshelf model in your .gazebo/models folder
  5. run the following in a third terminal; it just spawns and deletes models repeatedly with gzfactory
for i in `seq 1 10`; do \
  gzfactory spawn -f ~/.gazebo/models/bookshelf/model-1_3.sdf -m bookshelf_$i && \
  sleep 0.5 && \
  gzfactory delete -m bookshelf_$i && \
  sleep 0.5; done

After a couple iterations, it will hang, which can be verified by watching gzstats. I did gdb gzserver one time to see where it was hanging and got a backtrace:
